intro: Lachnaea ericoides, commonly known as the heath lousewort, is a small, flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils found in heathlands and bogs. The plant features tiny, pink or purple flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are narrow and densely packed. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. Lachnaea ericoides plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
